text:
Amber clear with a off white head. Malt, hops and caramel aroma. Bitter taste with a malt and light smoke end.
Shared with CH-303 - thanks!, 500 ml
Info: 25/2-2017, BB: 15/3-2017

Sample from 75cl? plastic bottle.. 
Poured mahogany color with a thin white head. 
Aroma has bread, sweetness, caramel. 
Toasty, caramelly, bready notes. Sweet, toasty finish.

50cl bottle from a trade with Cuso, many thanks! Pours clear amber colour with a mid-sized most good lasting off-white head. Aroma of reddish malt and nuts. Taste of nutty hops, caramel, reddish malt, spicy hoppy finish.

Appearance: Medium brown, clear. Some off-white head.
Aroma: Dark malt, wood. Sweetness.
Taste: Dark malt, sweetness. Lightly roasted. Smooth.
Bought: Trade with Cuso - thanks!, 500 ml
Info: 25/2-2017, BB: 15/3-2017

on tap at Clock Block. Clear amber color with medium good lasting white head. Aroma: roasted malt, caramel, grassy. Taste: roasted malt, grassy, toasted bread. Medium body, soft carbonation. Light bitterness.

Draught at Stupavar Beer Pub cons 2016-11-22 Bratislava 
AR: dust and cardboard
AP: hazy amber, wee beige
F: wee smoked, thin, rustic bread, dry 3,2
Tap at Stupavar beer pub. Amber color, stable white head. Aroma is malty, light caramel, hops, some floral notes. Taste is solid malty with caramel, light candies, medium bitter finish
Tap at stupavar pub. Dark amber colour with white head off. Aroma of malt,caramel. Taste is semisweet,caramel,bread. Watery body,light bitter aftertaste.

Bottle thanks to Nikos! I sorta dropped this one on its cap, so there was an impressive amount of gushing, but not the beers fault. Pours hazy amber, long lasting medium beige head, dissipates slowly with nice lacing. Aroma is for all intents and purposes a wild beer - funky, oaky, light smoke and lemon. Flavor is quite different, not funky or tart, light sweet, light bitter, oak, light smoke, toffee, perhaps a bit of acidity. Medium body. Certainly not what I would expect of a Polotmavy, but I enjoyed this one.
1000ml PET from brewery in Stupava. Roasty aroma, sweeter taste with small bitter aftertaste. Good beer.
On tap at Beervana in ilina,bitter sweet flavour,ligh bodies,pours amber color,aroma malty.

Clear ruby color with solid beige foam head. The smell is mild a a tiny bit roasty. The smell has a good part of coffee and roasted but still mild like a svetly. Weird taste but quite nice. Short aftertaste.
Good beer overall..small white head and orange body, smells sweety and bready, taste of toasted malt and grain, nice smoky flavour and sligtly bitter first and aftertaste..will have another one :)

on tap at Kontakt Pub, Bratislava. redish filtered color, white head. light smell of wheat and yeast. light body. bitter. bitter tastes of burned grain, a bit smoky and some bread. a lot of bitter taste and not much else.
On tap at Pivovarský Hostinec Richtár Jakub, Bratislava. Pours dark orange with big white head. Malty caramel, light roastiness and hoppiness. Light bitterness in the finish.

PET BOTTLE 1L from Slovak Crew.

Look: almost clear copper, beige creamy head.
Aroma: light, medium toast bread crust, grainy, a tad of caramel, some yeast.
Taste: light caramel sweetness, a bit bready and grainy, nice spicy hop bitterness in the finish.

Bottle. Thanks to Cuso. Amber body with white head. Aroma is malts with hints of sour cherries. Taste is slightly roasted malts with some nuts and some hints of fruits. Aftertaste is slightly bitter with malts.

Jun 14. A 1 l plastic bottle kindly shared by the Slovakian RB crew, thanks! It poured hazy amber, lightly copper body with a quite small head. Aroma of toasted malt like caramel and toast, a bit of burnt sugar. Herbal hops were here as well. Bitter flavor, hops tend to balance it out much more now with malt notes being less sweet than in nose, but still toasted. Not bad. Medium bodied, moderate finish, follows the flavor being rather short and notably on the bitter side. Although simple it was quite fine and pleasant polotmavy.
Bottle thanks to Cuso. Pours brown off white head. Nose/taste of baked bread, herbal tea, caramel, light spicy yeast and toasted nuts. Lighter bodied. Touch watery on the palate.

brown plastic bottle 1000ml. -brought by Slovak guys (thanks!) Pale amber coloured, minimal off-white head, light caramel in the nose. Moderate malty, some caramel, touch of herbal hops and slight dry nutty finish. Not bad but still could be better.

From the Slovak Crew, thanks! Darker misty amber body with a tiny white head. Slightly roasty aroma, some fresh herbal notes, somewhat interesting, light coffee. Nice light roasty taste, coffee, some caramel, weak herbal notes again if I remember correctly too. Not bad at all.
Vycap Richtar Jakub. Tmava medena farba, biela pena. Vona sladova, jemne karamel a ovocne otny. Chutovo prijemne pivo, sladovost, karamel, ovocie a v pozadi lahke chmelove tony.
Grainy with some wheat and acid. Caramel and lots of bread in the finish. Did not match my taste that night. Below average.

1 l plastic bottle from Cuso - many thanks, Imro. The beer pours out in a cloudy amber-red colour with steady head and medium body. Aroma of nuts and straw. Taste of mild hops, malt, barley, acid, berries, grass and grains. Mild and grainy finish.

1 Liter plastic bottle from Cuso, many thanks Imro: Nice amber color, off-white creamy head. Aroma is malty, caramelic, light fruity and light hoppy. Flavor is also malty/caramelic, grassy and herbal hops. Easy drinkable and tasty.

1 000 ml plastic bottle. BB 30/Maj/2014. From Cuso. Thanks!
Cloudy amber colour with a small light tan head.
Very strong sweet butter (diacetyl) aroma with some maltiness. The flavour is sweetness, roasted malt, coffee notes and mild bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 1l in Helsinki. Thanks to Rosenbergh. BBE 30/05/2014. Colour is slightly cloudy orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, caramel, some fruits and malts. Strong diacetyl aroma.

(Bottle, 1 l plastic bottle - BB 30 Maj 2014, courtesy of rosenbergh, 20140519) The beer poured brown and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had butter, caramel and sweetness. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were sweetness, caramel, butter, malts, molasses and bitterness. Aftertaste was sweet, malty and bitter. A decent malty brew.

1 liter plastic bottle from trade with Cuso, thanks! Poured into a tulip glass, ABV 4.8%
Light amber colour on the body, very clear and transparent, with a small and thin off-white head on top, with low retention, leaving minimal lacing on the glass.
Aroma has lots of caramel, toffee, sweet Id say, with nice floral notes popping every now and then. 
Nice taste, caramel and fresh floral hops, toffee. Moderate bitterness on the finish, lasts long enough on the aftertaste.
 Medium thin body, carbonation is okay, maybe a bit low at first but at the end works just fine.
Overall, a good beer, pleasant to drink and easy too.

From 1,0l PET bottle, BBD: 25.02.2014. Appearance: Pours nice clear amber-orange liquid with NO head! (I suppose should be some bad bottle) Aroma: Malt, caramel, sweet/ fruit, light orange somewhere behind. Aroma is not very intense. Taste: Medium sweet, medium bitter. Palate: medium body, thin texture, soft carbonation (thinking it should be connected with the missing head), bitter finish. Overall: Nice drinkable amber lager, no head and rather soft carbonation deceived me, but I believe it was only a bad poured bottle, so It did not affected my rating even though I expected more from this lager.

0.1l plastic bottles from trade with Misow. Thanks man! This big bottle brings back some good and some bad memories from my youth. It looks quit nice in the glass with a big frothy off-white head and a light blurry kinda orange amber looking body thats filled with lots of floaters and small sediments in the glass. The nose is light caramel and almost a little ripe fruity. Behind the sweetness there is a soft sourness lurking. Hope its still OK this. Hints of metal and malts. Not bad at all. In the taste Im quickly calmed and can safely report that its quite alright despite my suspicions. It has a average light oily mouthfeel and its just above average on the carbonation level. Soft watery caramel in the taste. Its a bit pilsner-ish in that near metallic way. Not overwhelming or to memorable but its a good thirst quencher - and there is lots of beer to quench that nasty thirst. Ends with traces of some berries and a soft round pilsner bitterness. Thanks for the bottle Mikal, Ill be sipping on this all night! 02.10.2013

Flaka(zase darek z Prepurku, děkují!): Deep golden, hazy, quite stable off-white creamy head, traces of noble hops in the sweet-bitter caramelly-bisquity nose; solid bitter-sweet flavour, light bodied; lingering bitter-sweet finish, hops and bisquits detectable. Pěkné slovenské pivo
Bottle. Pours amber color with white head. Aroma is malty, hints of honey and caramel. Tastes medium sweet, some hops. Low bitter finish.

Appearance: Light hazy deep golden color with a white layer head that leaves an ok lacing.Aroma: Deep malty and a bit sour.Palate: Medium + body. Moderate sweet and a moderate bitterness. Soft carbonation.Taste: Soft malty and a fine fruity background.Overall impression: Not any pleasant aroma, but a quite nice and fresh taste.Personal stats: On tap at Novomestsky Pivovar in Bratislava, Slovakia.

Tasting at Hostinec Richtar Jakub. Clear orange to amber colour. Aroma a bit mild, malty, honey. Taste is mostly hoppy, grassy bitterness - a bit sharp/rough. Finish is medium duration, hoppy bitter. The sharp earthy/grassy bitterness does not work well with the overall character of this beer in my opinion.

Bottle direct from the brewery in Stupava, just NW of Bratislava  , fine amber colour, slightly hazy, long lasting head. Delicious malty taste. A bitter and hoppy finish, Stands out from the crowd. I think the  leziak and  Jantar are actually the same beer. But since this is a bit distinct from the usual Czech-Slovak pilsner, Jantar (amber) is the brand name.
Tap at Hostinec Richtar Jakub. Amber color with medium off-white head. Malty aroma with caramel, some fruits. taste, malt, caramel bitter hops. Nice light bitter finish. Good.

Tapped. Dominant malty aroma, fine amber color, nice hazy and most of all very very long lasting head. Delicious malty taste. A bitter and hoppy finish, not so significant but satisfying. Overall refreshing and tasty.
